snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said he was flying home to Washington to meet with President Obama to reassess the peace negotiations, and whether there is a path forward.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry will return to Washington to meet with Pres Obama to reassess the Middle East peace process; concedes that he has experienced a 'reality check' over past week as Israel and the Palestinians have fallen back into a familiar cycle of tit-for-tat retribution; potential collapse of talks is particularly dispiriting as Kerry has poured an enormous amount of energy into them over 14 months at his post.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Rabat, and Mark Landler from Washington. Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said he was flying home to Washington to meet with President Obama to reassess the peace negotiations, and whether there is a path forward.

headline.main: U.S. to Reassess Status of Talks on Middle East
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Reassess Status of Talks on Middle East
